book_details.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
book_details.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
book_details.author: Bessel van der Kolk

reviews.review_description: A book about understanding the impact of trauma by one of the true pioneers in the field

book_details.title: IT STARTS WITH US
book_details.description: In the sequel to “It Ends With Us,” Lily deals with her jealous ex-husband as she reconnects with her first boyfriend.
book_details.author: Colleen Hoover

reviews.review_description: This book is a tour de force. Its deeply empathic, insightful, and compassionate perspective promises to further humanize the treatment of trauma victims, dramatically expand their repertoire of self-regulatory healing practices and therapeutic options, and also stimulate greater creative thinking and research on trauma and its effective treatment.

book_details.title: SWEET TOMORROWS
book_details.description: The journeys of the characters at the Rose Harbor Inn come to a close in this last book of the series.
book_details.author: Debbie Macomber

reviews.review_description: Love the book, however I wish it didn’t have the yellow circle ‘sticker’ on the front! You can’t remove it as it is part of the cover

book_details.title: HIDDEN FIGURES
book_details.description: The black women mathematicians who worked at then-segregated NASA. The basis of the movie.
book_details.author: Margot Lee Shetterly

reviews.review_description: Macomber fans will leave the Rose Harbor Inn with warm memories of healing, hope, and enduring love

book_details.title: IT'S ALL GOOD
book_details.contributor: by Gwyneth Paltrow and Julia Turshen
book_details.author: Gwyneth Paltrow and Julia Turshen

reviews.review_description: I'm delighted that this cookbook is so highly rated on Amazon, because it deserves it.

book_details.title: KINDRED
book_details.description: A woman travels through time — from the 1970s to the pre-Civil War era — in this adaptation of Butler’s 1979 novel.
book_details.contributor: by Octavia E. Butler, Damian Duffy and John Jennings
book_details.author: Octavia E Butler, Damian Duffy and John Jennings

reviews.review_description: Wonderful. Captures the essence of Octavia Butler’s vision even as it demonstrates the superlative skills of Duffy and Jennings.

book_details.title: THE HIT
book_details.description: The government hit man Will Robie uncovers a serious threat as he tries to stop Jessica Reel, a fellow assassin who has gone rogue.
book_details.author: David Baldacci

reviews.review_description: A great second offering in the series. Really fast paced. Like how he harkens back to first book some but keeps the story going.

book_details.title: THE PERKS OF BEING A WALLFLOWER
book_details.description: What it’s like to grow up, from the perspective of a high school boy.
book_details.author: Stephen Chbosky

reviews.review_description: Of course I loved the book. It's so much more than young-adult combing-of-age

book_details.title: CONFIDENCE MAN
book_details.description: The New York Times White House correspondent traces events from Donald Trump’s rise in New York City through to his post-presidency. Read by the author. 17 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
book_details.author: Maggie Haberman

reviews.review_description: Delivers eye-popping details about the Trump presidency

book_details.title: LET'S EXPLORE DIABETES WITH OWLS
book_details.description: A humorist returns with more wry takes on contemporary life.
book_details.author: David Sedaris
